lyrics.text:
As a mother stills her child, thou canst hush the ocean wild; boisterous waves obey thy will,
when thou sayest to them, "Be still!" Wondrous sovereign of the sea, Jesus, Savior, pilot me.

When at last I near the shore, and the fearful breakers roar 'twixt me and the peaceful rest,
then, while leaning on thy breast, may I hear thee say to me, "Fear not, I will pilot thee."
